captions.text:
00:02
SHANNEN: Winter!

00:08
COMM: This is Winter. The tiny lamb who became

a massive sensation on Vine, at one point
racking up eleven million loops in under seventy
two hours.

00:18
SHANNEN: Winter! You're so cute. So cute.

00:26
COMM: Winter was born in August 2014 in Melbourne,

Australia. And his owner Shannen Hussein started
filming him from just two days old. But a

couple of weeks later when the excitable little
chap started bouncing up and down the hallway

when his name was called, an internet star
was born. With his first Vine alone getting
over 34 million loops.

00:47
SHANNEN: I love it, he's so cute, look at
his little horns.

00:51
COMM: As well as hopping down hallways Winter
also likes bouncing on beds.

01:00
COMM: And gambling on the grass.

01:02
SHANNEN: Winter!

01:06
COMM: But when he's not jumping up and down

he stays as close to Shannen's side as he
can. And though he doesn't mix with the other

sheep, he doesn't mind the company of the
cat and the ducklings.

01:18
COMM: Winter has recently returned to Vine,

and at almost six months old he still likes
bouncing on the bed, but he may be getting
a bit big for it now.

title: Cute Bouncing Lamb Becomes Huge Internet Star

comments.author: Kai Spencer

comments.text:
Okay, so lemme get this straight...this woman took a small newborn lamb 
away from it's mother to bottle raise it as a pet. The poor thing never got 
to be a lamb and therefore more then likely thinks he is a human. Sheep and 
lambs are farm stock and though they are cute are way too big to keep in a 
house and could hurt kids and many other things. This is also not mentally 
healthy for the poor sheep and fair to him. Again, nice move...not.﻿
comments.author: Elektra Morgan

comments.text:
+Shannen Hussein
Castrated? Ouch, there goes his manliness.
comments.author: Kaze Araki

comments.text:
Sorry but this lamb would not be alive if I didn't take him in. His twin 
passed just as we found them and Winters fate wasn't looking much better if 
I didn't take him. Also we live on a farm so have heaps of space to keep 
sheep and other livestock. He doesn't live inside- he wasn't inside for too 
long mainly just to get some recordings and now as he is almost fully grown 
i rarely ever bring him inside and if I do it's only for a few minutes. We 
are well aware of how dangerous a male sheep can be and had him with that 
had him castrated at a young age but i still limit any physical contact as 
a precaution.
comments.author: Shannen Hussein (Life Of Shannen)

comments.text:
+Hannah Calvin yes, i realized that, i was replying Venusia Venus's comment 
about there being no snow in Australia. A friend of mine spent 2 Canadian 
summers in Australia as a ski instructor at Mt. Buller.
comments.author: Ty Lockton

comments.text:
+Ty Lockton " The seasons in the temperate zone are described in terms of 
European seasons applied to the southern hemisphere in the following 
sequence: Summer: December to February. Autumn: March to May. Winter: June 
to August." This lamb was born in August according the the video, thus 
making the season winter.
comments.author: Hannah Calvin

comments.text:
Do your research. There is plenty of snow in Australia and Altitude is the 
reason. You can Alpine ski or snowboard in Australia and New Zealand as 
well as a number of places in Africa. 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skiing_in_Australia  
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ski_areas_and_resorts_in_Africa
comments.author: Ty Lockton

comments.text: +Hannah Calvin Ok.
comments.author: Venusia Venus (The Venus Girls Zone)

comments.text: I meant in reference to your original comment, not most recent.
comments.author: Hannah Calvin

comments.text: +Hannah Calvin How is it invalid? .I just said " i know that".
comments.author: Venusia Venus (The Venus Girls Zone)

comments.text:
So your comment is invalid. Australia is close to the equator, thus in 
summer they just have mild temps, no snow. So this animal was born in 
winter, and that's why he was named winter, snow or not.
comments.author: Hannah Calvin

comments.text: +Hannah Calvin I know that.
comments.author: Venusia Venus (The Venus Girls Zone)

comments.text:
+Venusia Venus Winter is a season, not a type of weather. Depending on how 
close or far away from the equator you are determines if you have snow in 
the winter.... They teach this to 3rd graders along with the water cycle.
comments.author: Hannah Calvin
